title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content: 00:03  has joined #xwiki 00:07  has quit 00:07  is now known as 00:19  has joined #xwiki 00:29  has joined #xwiki 00:48  has quit 01:09  has quit 01:36  has joined #xwiki 01:37  has quit 01:37  has quit 02:15  has quit 04:21  is now known as 04:24  has quit 07:00  has joined #xwiki 07:03  has quit 08:12  has joined #xwiki 08:14  Marius Dumitru Florea feature-applicationWithinMinutes \* r046e901 / (13 files in 2 dirs): Merge branch 'master' of github.com:xwiki/xwiki-platform into feature-applicationWithinMinutes - http://git.io/ovtIAw 08:39  has quit 08:40  has joined #xwiki 08:42  is now known as 08:52  has joined #xwiki 09:10  good morning 09:11  I sent a mail yesterday on [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) did you get it? 09:11  ah yes it's working (thought it wasn't) just sent a mail and I've received it now 09:23  has joined #xwiki 09:29  Hi all 09:29  hi guillaume 09:30  In order to stick to the behavior of the current velocity #panel, I need to get the page name from the macro context. 09:30  How do I do that ? 09:30  we store a reference to the location of the content in MetaDataBlock 09:30  velocity code is using this to add a 'class' attribute computed from this document name 09:30  (same as for the Syntax) 09:31  And where is this MetadataBlock ? 09:31  so when you have a Block you need to look into its ancestors and find a MetaDataBlock with a SOURCE key 09:31  Do I have to search in the XDom this first metadatablock ? 09:31  the same code that thomas gave you yesterday for syntax 09:31  \*finding the syntax 09:32  ok (hopefully I still have the discussion history ;)) 09:32  ihttp://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/ 09:32  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/ 09:33  16:15 on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20111026 09:33  just replace SYNTAX by SOURCE 09:34  that returns a simple String or another type ? 09:34  the implementation returns an entity reference 09:34  (a document entity reference to be precise) 09:35  as a String 09:35      /\*\* 09:35       \* Represents a source metaData, which corresponds to the reference to the source entity containing the content to 09:35       \* render. The reference is a free form text in a format that is understood by the Listeners supporting it. 09:35       \*/ 09:35      public static final String SOURCE = "source"; 09:35  At the end, I need a string 09:36  it'll be in the form: "wiki:space.page" 09:36  (AFAIR) 09:36  ok 09:36  which you can parse with a DocumentReferenceResolver if you need 09:36  In my case, that will returns me the page name that is "hosting" the {{panel}} right ? 09:37  indeed 09:37  that was just to be sure ;) 09:37  wait 09:37  depend what you mean by "hosting" 09:37  it'll be the reference to the page being rendered 09:38  (not the panel page) 09:38  the {{panel}} is it's own page. And the panel pages gets included into the whole rendered page, right ? 09:39  AFAIU, the velocity mechanism refeers to the panel page, right ? 09:39  it's using a $paneldoc in macros.vm but I couldn't determine where does this variables comes from 09:39  let me search 09:42  paneldoc is set in displaypanel velocimacro which is called by: 09:43  endpage.vm 09:43  #template("leftpanels.vm") 09:43    ## leftsidecolumns 09:43  #template("rightpanels.vm") 09:44  leftpanels and rightpanels do this: 09:44  #foreach($panel in $leftPanels) 09:44  #displaypanel($panel.trim()) 09:44  #end 09:44  $doc is always the current page (not the panel page) 09:44  $paneldoc is the panel page 09:45  if you need paneldoc then you need to get it from the execution context 09:45  is that what you need? 09:46  has quit 09:46  has joined #xwiki 09:48  I want to mimic the current #panelheader behavior to ease migration 09:49  Ultimately, this is the following line that I need to redo in Java: 09:50  #if ($paneldoc) 09:50    #set ($specialClassAttribute = $util.convertToAlphaNumeric($paneldoc.name)) 09:50  #end 09:50  it's going to be a bit of a a hack but here's how you can do it 09:50  So it's paneldoc that is needed 09:50  get yourself injected the Execution component: 09:50  @Inject private Execution execution 09:50  then use this: 09:51  (VelocityContext) (((Map) this.execution.getContext().getProperty("xwikicontext")).get("vcontext")).get("paneldoc") 09:51  you can write it on several lines ;) 09:51  ok got it :) 09:51  BTW, the archetype (I've used the stable one) is not using @Inject, it(s still using @Requirement 09:51  you can cast what you get into a DocumenytModelBridge object I think 09:52  What is the artifactId for Execution interface ? 09:53  xwiki-commons-context 09:54  has joined #xwiki 09:56  gsauthier: indeed the archetyp catalog is still referencing the old 3.0 version… fixing it thanks 09:57  gsauthier: should be ok now 10:00  has quit 10:01  tmortagne: hmm I see that the component archetype module is in platform. Do you see any problem moving it in commons tools? 10:02 <+tmortagne> vmassol: not really, as long as it's only about commons it should be in commons 10:02  ok will move it now 10:06  has joined #xwiki 10:07  hmm atually we should ask to be in the central archetype catalog for our archetypes that are on central: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/archetype-catalog.xml 10:09  wow this is so cool 10:09  we're already there :) 10:09  it's parsed automatically when artifacts are uploaded to central 10:09  I'll update the documentation! 10:10  and remove our archetype-catalog.xml 10:15  tmortagne: I propose to move the compoent archetype tool as a submodule of commons-component instead of a tool 10:15  xwiki-commons-component-archetype 10:17 <+tmortagne> +1 10:21  has quit 10:22  has joined #xwiki 10:37  gsauthier: I had documented the test format a bit here: http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ExtendingMacro#HTestingtheMacro 10:37 <+sburjan`> good morning 10:38 <+sburjan`> I see a vote on devlist: Make org.xwiki.rendering.internatl.macroMacroContentParser public. This means we'll be able to parse XML files/strings ? I would appreciate some help to finalize/improve it. 11:56  Denis: sorry I don't have time today but yes you could put it on a branch and then do a pull request asking for feedback 11:57  pull request is the canonical way to ask for help 11:59 <+Denis> just want to put something in, I am sure you will have remarks, this is a major change in some ways, and it was not has easy as we have thought. Any respectable CMS has this, now it's time for us to have one :D 18:30 <+tmortagne> sburjan: the idea is that in 3.3 you can install in your XE any valid extension on extension.xwiki.org using extension manager 18:31 <+sburjan> yes, so no more xar import and stuff 18:31 <+sburjan> I'm pretty sure there is a complex architecture behind it 18:31 <+tmortagne> it's not only xar but jars too 18:31 <+tmortagne> yes there is a bit of work ;) 18:36  has quit 18:47  stop the bot before thomas maybe 19:01  has quit 19:07  Vincent Massol master \* rc6d8759 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects/src/main/java/org/xwiki/test/po/PersistentTestContext.java : Document how to make Selenium use your existing FF profile (useful to have Firebug) - http://git.io/LeLxzA 19:09  mflorea: I'm trying to debug why the tests using the livetable are failing 19:09  what I'm seeing is that apparently this line isn't doing anything anymore: 19:09          executeJavascript("document.observe('xwiki:livetable:" + this.livetableId + ":displayComplete', function() {" 19:09              + "document.body.insert(new Element('div', {'id' : 'uitest-livetable-status' }).update('complete'));});"); 19:10  do you know if we've changed anything around livetable events? or would you have any idea why this wouln't work anymore? 19:10  (the div is never created) 19:10 <+mflorea> hmm, I don't remember any changes to the live table events 19:11  hmmm 19:11  maybe the livetable has already sent the even before we add the observes 19:12 <+mflorea> yes, that's possible 19:12 <+mflorea> let me check is the event is still fired 19:13  let me try something too 19:17 <+mflorea> the event is fired, I tested on 3.2 final 19:17  where do I see the events in FB? 19:18 <+mflorea> no, I added a jsx to the Main.SpaceIndex page that loads only on that page and added the listener 19:18 <+mflorea> document.observe('xwiki:livetable:spaceindex:displayComplete', function() { 19:18 <+mflorea>   alert('livetable loaded!'); 19:18 <+mflorea> }); 19:18  it's not possible to see them in FB?
